body_html:
F.softmax should return one-hot representation when only 1 value is Inf and the others are all finite or -Inf.

This is true in the limit sense only, if one of the values is inf softmax is in \inf/\inf indeterminate form, so it's an open question what it should return. For most operations, limit answers won't be returned (e.g. if you try to compute sin(x)/x for x=0, the answer will be nan or fpe, not 1). I don't know if this particular case merits special treatment.
